intro: Aucuba cavinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined aucuba, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cornaceae, which includes willows and snowberries. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with prominent, narrow veins. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in catkins, typically blooming in the spring. Aucuba cavinervis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
